contentrichtext.text: '''''Gift''''' is a 1993 film made by [[Perry Farrell]] and [[Casey Niccoli]] that features Farrell's band [[Jane's Addiction]]. ''Gift'' was released by [[Warner Brothers]]. The following Jane's Addiction songs are featured in the soundtrack: * "Stop" * "Classic Girl" * "Ain't No Right" * "Of Course" * "Three Days" In addition, John Frusciante (who would soon be replaced in the Red Hot Chili Peppers by Jane's Addiction member Dave Navarro) recorded the song "Ants" which features in this film. This was later released on initial cassette versions of his album [[Niandra Lades and Usually Just a T-Shirt]] in 1994, and accordingly credits the song to being from this film. Farrell and rapper [[Ice-T]] also do a version of [[Sly and the Family Stone]]'s [[Don't Call Me Nigger, Whitey]] in the film as well. All of the filming for the movie took place around the time of the recording sessions for [[Ritual de lo Habitual]] in 1990. ==See also== *[[Gothic rock]] ==External links== *{{imdb title|id=0107011|title=Gift}} {{Jane's Addiction}} [[Category:1993 films]] [[Category:Jane's Addiction]] {{musical-film-stub}}
